channel.title: Windows 7 Steam Font?
channel.description:
I just switched to Windows 7, and it's okay so far, but I'm having problems with the font used in steam chats. The problem is, I don't like it. Actually worse, staring at it for too long makes me feel nauseous. People keep saying I should get used to it, but with me actually feeling sick looking at it, I don't think that's going to happen. I was wondering if there was any way to revert back to font XP used in Steam chat.
I liked the old one [i]much[/i] better than the new one. It was sharper, clearer, and better spaced out. The new one is kinda blurry and compacted, and makes me feel sick. :sick:
Comparison of the 2 fonts. ![](upload://4TbjeI9UUyNGmMnSFtcgYDEH3dA.png)
So I'm asking, is there any way at all to revert to the old XP style Font?
[url=https://i542.photobucket.com/albums/gg410/Mr_Someguy/itsabar.png]Also, a bar[/url](it's a line of quotation marks, but due to the way my font is, it appears as a solid bar).

item.title: Windows 7 Steam Font?
item.dc:creator: Hyperbyte
item.description:
Mr. Someguy:

The font on the right is terrible. :mono:

Actually, the fonts in those two screenshots are exactly the same. Try overlaying the two "I thought"s in there, they match 100%. The only thing that is different is that the system in the screenshot on the right has font anti-aliasing enabled.

I personally think the one on the right is much easier on the eyes, but if you disagree you might want to disable font smoothing in Windows 7. I have no idea how to accomplish that, but Google can probably tell you.
